definition: horizontal rectangular inscribed tablet hung over a door or on a wall/shallow round woven bamboo basket
forehead/horizontal tablet or inscribed board/specified number or amount

sentences.english: From then on, Manchurian appeared on the horizontal board of Forbidden City.
sentences.chinese: 從此，紫禁城的匾額上出現了滿文。

sentences.english: They even say that there is a plaque at the entrance to the temple with Sanskrit writing.
sentences.chinese: 他們還告訴我在廟的入口處還有個寫着梵文的匾額。

sentences.english: The inscriptions in the plaque means only the benevolent emperor can live a long life.
sentences.chinese: 匾額上的字“壽協仁符”意思是施仁政者能長壽。

sentences.english: This is a horizontal inscribed board of Huan-Presbyterian original handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 匾額是本煥長老的手跡。

sentences.english: At the same year for Japanese rock, hand County 《 the kind thoughts temple 》 writes the horizontal tablet.
sentences.chinese: 同年爲日本巖手縣《善念寺》題寫匾額。

sentences.english: and they have like a little plaque on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 他們希望能得到一塊掛在牆上的匾額。

sentences.english: There is only in China that the tablet introduces the literary into architecture.
sentences.chinese: 匾額把文學引入建築，爲中國獨有。

definition: to write a letter (to the authorities)/to present a petition
couplet (hung on the columns of a hall)
rhyming couplet/pair of lines of verse written vertically down the sides of a doorway/CL:副[fu4],幅[fu2]
gold and jade in glorious splendor (idiom)/fig. a dazzling sight (e.g. royal palace)
place at the imperial court, where emperor handled government affairs, gave orders etc
portrait/to do a portrait of sb
